page.title: 06CHILWELL. Local History.
page.content: In{July 1918}there was a large explosion at the Chilwell shell filling factory on the west side of the village. Many were killed. "A huge pall of smoke appeared before anyone realised what had happened. I remember sitting up most of the night watching the lorries passing laden with injured and many workers struggling home, suffering badly from shock. The next day I accompanied my grandmother in a landau, perched on the box beside the driver searching the hospitals for an uncle, who we found had died on admission to the General Hospital."
